medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with nystagmus and whitish pupils noted at birth.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms were observed at birth, specifically the whitish pupils, and the patient showed developmental delay by not being able to lift his head at three months old. Severe posterior capsular opacification was noticed in his right eye at the three-month follow-up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of corpus callosum hypoplasia, increased blood pressure in the intracranial artery, patent foramen ovale, cryptorchidism, and congenital membranous cataracts.
